intro: Cleome longipes, commonly known as the spider flower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that resemble spiders, hence its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 2 to 4 feet and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of heart-shaped, green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Cleome longipes is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive blooms and ease of care.
